alert.note: Alert for Butler; Clinton; Greene; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 7:18AM EDT until May 07 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Southwest Ohio, Butler, Clinton and Warren. In West Central Ohio, Greene. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 718 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Middletown, Mason, Lebanon, Wilmington, Monroe, Trenton, Waynesville, Sabina, Morrow, South Lebanon, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Corwin, Port William, Kingman, Caesar Creek State Park, Oakland, Ogden, State Route 350 at US Route 22 and Mount Holly.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
